abstract.p: New York Rangers Coach Ron Low expresses concern about goalie Kirk McLean's back spasms during training camp (S)

block.p: If Kirk McLean was not concerned, Coach Ron Low sure was. ''Very much so,'' Low said, after McLean came up with back spasms in the Rangers' camp.
McLean, the starting goaltender while Mike Richter recuperates from knee surgery, played down the severity of the spasms and said he would probably be ready to practice this morning.
If Kirk McLean was not concerned, Coach Ron Low sure was. ''Very much so,'' Low said, after McLean came up with back spasms in the Rangers' camp.
McLean, the starting goaltender while Mike Richter recuperates from knee surgery, played down the severity of the spasms and said he would probably be ready to practice this morning.

''I just need a little rest to loosen it up,'' the 34-year-old goaltender said. But Low seemed a little upset that McLean continued to practice until the first session of the day was through in Burlington, Vt.
''If it got worse on him, he should have likely gone off,'' said Low, a former National Hockey League goaltender. ''Back spasms are something you don't want to have at this point in time.''
In the Rangers' case, especially because Richter is out until mid-October, at least, leaving the untested 28-year-old Jean-Francois Labbe as McLean's probable backup.
